content.full_text:
Abraham Lincoln to William H. Herndon, 12 December 18471 As soon as theCongressional Globeand Appendix begins to issue, I shall send you a copy of it regularly– I wish you

to read it, or as much of it as you please, and be careful to preserve all the numbers,

so that we can have a complete file of it There is nothing new here, but what you see in the papers–
paragraphs: Abraham Lincoln to William H. Herndon, 12 December 18471 As soon as theCongressional Globeand Appendix begins to issue, I shall send you a copy of it regularly– I wish you
to read it, or as much of it as you please, and be careful to preserve all the numbers,
so that we can have a complete file of it There is nothing new here, but what you see in the papers–

footnotes.text: 1Abraham Lincoln wrote and signed the letter.

structured_content.text: Abraham Lincoln to William H. Herndon, 12 December 18471

As soon as theCongressional Globeand Appendix begins to issue, I shall send you a copy of it regularly– I wish you
               to read it, or as much of it as you please, and be careful to preserve all the numbers,
               so that we can have a complete file of it
There is nothing new here, but what you see in the papers–
